inputs.notes: Infratil is an investment holding company. FCF based on normalized NetParentSurplus (FY2025 was negative due to revaluations). Using FY2022-2024 average adjusted for portfolio growth.

historical_growth.growth_divergence_warning: Infratil as an investment holding company has volatile net income/FCF due to revaluations. Using ShareOfEBITDAF (21.8% CAGR) and TotalEquity (28.6% CAGR) as primary growth indicators. Selected 20% conservative rate given strong CDC/Longroad growth drivers.

base.notes: Base case reflects CDC doubling EBITDAF by FY27, Longroad scaling to 10GW by 2028, but tempered by NZ economic weakness and interest rate headwinds

bull.notes: Bull case: AI data centre supercycle sustained, CDC pipeline conversion accelerates, Longroad-Meta synergies expand, portfolio NAV discount narrows with ASX 200 inclusion

bear.notes: Bear case: AI bubble deflates impacting CDC valuations, NZ recession deepens, higher-for-longer interest rates compress multiples, execution risks on US$2-3bn Gurin project

analyst_notes.valuation_approach: Infratil is an infrastructure investment holding company, not an operating business. Traditional DCF is challenging due to: (1) Volatile net income from portfolio revaluations, (2) No traditional revenue/operating margins, (3) Value primarily from portfolio NAV appreciation and distributions. This DCF uses normalized FCF based on proportionate EBITDAF trends and historical distribution capacity.
key_considerations: CDC concentration (41% of portfolio) drives much of the growth outlook - bull/bear cases heavily dependent on data centre demand trajectory
Current price NZ$11.03 is below analyst consensus NZ$13.58, suggesting market pricing in execution risks or CDC valuation concerns
Historical 10-year TSR of 17% p.a. vs 11-15% target demonstrates value creation track record, supporting higher probability weight to base/bull cases
NZ$1bn divestment program (58% complete) should improve portfolio quality and provide dry powder for opportunistic investments
Interest rate sensitivity is high - WACC assumptions critical. Using 10.5% base (infrastructure typical 9-11% range, but Infratil has execution risk premium)
analyst_notes.growth_rate_justification: Base case 18-10% declining growth over 5 years reflects: (1) CDC targeting to double FY25 EBITDAF by FY27 (implies ~40% CAGR near-term), (2) Longroad scaling from 3.5GW to 10GW by 2028, (3) Contact-Manawa merger synergies, (4) Offset by One NZ maturity and NZ economic headwinds, (5) Deceleration toward terminal as high-growth projects mature.
analyst_notes.wacc_calculation: Base WACC 10.5% = Risk-free rate 4.5% (NZ 10-year govt bond) + Beta 1.2 (infrastructure with growth premium) Ã— Equity risk premium 5% + Small cap premium 0.5%. Bull case 9.5% assumes de-risking as CDC/Longroad deliver. Bear case 12% reflects elevated interest rates and execution risk premium.
analyst_notes.terminal_growth_justification: 3% terminal growth aligns with long-term GDP growth for diversified NZ/Australia/US portfolio. Infrastructure assets should grow with nominal GDP. Below historical given mature portfolio mix in terminal year.
analyst_notes.recommendation: Fair Value NZ$10.33 (base case) implies limited upside from current NZ$11.03, but probability-weighted IV of NZ$11.10 suggests Hold. Stock is fairly valued for balanced bull/bear risk. Entry price NZ$7.81 would provide attractive 15% CAGR to terminal. Monitor: (1) CDC contract announcements, (2) Divestment execution, (3) NZ economic recovery, (4) Interest rate trajectory.
